mapper.sql: select o.id as id, o.orderNo as orderNo, o.amount as amount, o.imprest as imprest,o.deliveryDate deliveryDate,o.desription desription, o.refund as refund, o.received as received,o.currentState as currentState, o.operatorId as operatorId , o.customerId as orderCustomerId, o.isValid as isValid, o.tenantId as tenantId, oi.id as itemId, oi.orderId as itemOrderId, oi.sellPrice as itemSellPrice, oi.area as itemArea, oi.amount as itemAmount, oi.floorId as itemFloorId, ost.orderId as stateTraceOrderId, ost.stateId as stateId, ost.operateDate as operateDate,f.id as floorId, f.floorName as floorName, f.number as floorNumber, f.categoryId as floorCategoryId, f.specId as floorSpecId, f.veinId as floorVeinId, f.colorCodeId as floorColorCodeId, fc.categoryName as categoryName, s.specName as specName, v.veinName as veinName, cc.colorCodeName as colorCodeName, c.id as customerId, c.customerName as customerName, c.linkman as linkman, c.phone as phone, c.address as address ,e.empName as operatorName from tbl_order o, tbl_customer c, tbl_order_item oi, tbl_order_state_trace ost, tbl_floor f, tbl_vein v, tbl_floor_category fc, tbl_spec s, tbl_color_code cc ,tbl_employee e where o.id = oi.orderId and o.id = ost.orderId and oi.floorId = f.id and o.customerId = c.id and f.veinId = v.id and f.specId = s.id and e.id = o.operatorId and f.colorCodeId = cc.id and f.categoryId = fc.id and o.id = #{orderId}
mapper.select:
select o.id as id, o.orderNo as orderNo, o.amount as amount, o.imprest as imprest, o.deliveryDate deliveryDate,o.desription desription, o.refund as refund, o.received as received, o.currentState as currentState, o.operateDate as operateDate, o.isValid as isValid, o.tenantId as tenantId, o.operatorId as operatorId, o.customerId as orderCustomerId, c.id as customerId, c.customerName as customerName, c.linkman as linkman, c.phone as phone, c.address as address , e.id as employeeId ,e.empName as employeeName, s.operateDate as operateDate from tbl_order o, tbl_customer c ,tbl_order_state_trace s,tbl_employee e
limit #{beginIndex} ,#{pageSize}
select count(*) from tbl_order o ,tbl_customer c ,tbl_order_state_trace s ,tbl_employee e
mapper.update: update tbl_order set received = #{received} ,currentState = #{currentState},operateDate = #{operateDate} where id = #{id}
update tbl_order set refund = #{refund} , currentState = #{currentState} , operateDate = #{operateDate} where id = #{id}
update tbl_order_update set status = 2 where status = 1 and oldOrderId = #{oldOrderId}
